sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt) - Metal supply stores or online metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supply companies or online specialty chemical retailers; Tb (Terbium) - Rare earth metal suppliers; Y (Yttrium) - Metal supply stores or online suppliers; Zr (Zirconium) - Metal supply stores or online suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt) - Metal supply stores or online metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supply companies or online specialty chemical retailers; Tb (Terbium) - Rare earth metal suppliers; Y (Yttrium) - Metal supply stores or online suppliers; Zr (Zirconium) - Metal supply stores or online suppliers.

1. Measure out each ingredient using a precise digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the measured Co, P, Tb, Y, and Zr. 3. Use a mechanical mixer to ensure a uniform blend for 30 minutes. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a vacuum-sealed bag to prevent contamination.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out each ingredient using a precise digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the measured Co, P, Tb, Y, and Zr. 3. Use a mechanical mixer to ensure a uniform blend for 30 minutes. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a vacuum-sealed bag to prevent contamination.

steps: 1. Preheat a sintering furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Place the vacuum-sealed bag in the furnace and hold at this temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a sintering furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Place the vacuum-sealed bag in the furnace and hold at this temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper alloy formation.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 4 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace during cooling to avoid oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 4 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace during cooling to avoid oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the sample from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective coating to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the sample from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective coating to enhance durability.
